config.unified_taming.misc.show_tamable_: Whether some of the messages should be sent to players when something happened to their pets, 0 means should not send messages, 1 means should send important messages, 2 means should always send messages
config.unified_taming.misc.ride_speed_mo: The speed modifier of the ride
config.unified_taming.misc.can_rider_int: Whether the rider can interact with the mob
config.unified_taming.misc.player_friend: Whether players can attack their own pets
config.unified_taming.misc.leashed_need_: Whether leash mobs need to be tamed
config.unified_taming.misc.golem_created: Whether golem will be tamed by the nearest player when created
config.unified_taming.misc.merchant_tame: The separately counted reputation value of the merchant tamed by player
config.unified_taming.compatibility.comp: Whether vanilla tamable mobs will use taming system of this mod
Whether vanilla tamable mobs will use moving goal system of this mod
Whether multipart mobs will use taming system of this mod
Whether a mob summoned by another mob will be tamed by the nearest mob
message.unified_taming.hurt.follow: %1$s is hurt when stopping and trying to follow you
patchouli.unified_taming.book.name: Unified Taming Tutorial
patchouli.unified_taming.book.landing_te: A mod that provides unified solutions to tame any mobs
patchouli.unified_taming.book.categories: Introduction for interacting with tamed mobs
patchouli.unified_taming.book.entries.ta: Tame creatures by consuming tame materials. The prerequisite for taming is that the health amount is lower than a certain value
In the creative mode, creative tame materials can be used for taming without any preconditions
patchouli.unified_taming.book.entries.in: The mode of the multi-functional tool can be switched by using the specified keys, and different modes specify different interaction methods

Specific modes can switch the states of creatures. In the following state, the creature will follow the player. In the stationary state, the creature will try to stay in place as much as possible. In the wandering mode, the creature will wander within a certain range

Specific modes can be used to ride creatures, and the riding speed is determined by the creature's speed attribute, not by its own speed controlled by AI. There are two riding modes. One is the autonomous driving mode, in which the movement is controlled by the creature's own AI. The other is the manual driving mode, in which the movement is controlled by the player. The direction the player faces is the direction of the movement, and the movement is carried out by controlling the movement keys

Players can also have creatures ride on them. In addition, one of the modes forces players to get out of the riding state and at the same time makes the creature they ride themselves get out of the riding state
Specific modes can feed creatures. Currently, all food that can be consumed by players is allowed. Hold the tool in hand and hold the food in the other hand, and you can feed it
